summary: An FBI Crisis Intake report from July 8, 2019, documenting a call from a business owner (name redacted) who provided information about Jeffrey Epstein. The caller reported that from 2006-2008, she sent her employees to Epstein's West Palm Beach home to perform manicures, pedicures, and waxing on topless young girls, who expressed discomfort but were paid well.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the child sex trafficking investigation. The report details allegations that young girls received services at his home while topless.

persons.name: Unnamed Business Owner
persons.context: A business owner who called the FBI to report that from 2001-2008, she owned a business in West Palm Beach and received calls from Epstein's associates to send employees to his home for services on young girls.

connections.description: The business owner's company was hired by Epstein's associates to provide manicure/pedicure services at his home from 2006-2008.
Epstein (via his associates) hired the business owner's employees to perform services on young girls at his home.
The report alleges young girls were present at Epstein's home receiving services while topless and expressed discomfort.

events.title: Regular service appointments at Epstein's home
events.description: Every three weeks, the business owner sent 3-4 employees to Jeffrey Epstein's West Palm Beach home to perform manicures, pedicures, and waxing on young girls who were usually topless.

events.title: FBI Crisis Intake report filed
events.description: A business owner called the FBI National Threat Operations Center to report information regarding Jeffrey Epstein and child sex trafficking allegations.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's home in West Palm Beach, FL (owned from 2001-2008)
keyFacts: A business owner reported to the FBI that from 2006-2008, she sent employees to Jeffrey Epstein's West Palm Beach home every three weeks to perform services on young girls.
The young girls receiving manicures, pedicures, and waxing were usually topless, which the employees found strange and the girls felt uncomfortable about.
Epstein paid well for these services, making it difficult for the business to refuse the jobs.
The business owner stated she still has the names of the employees who went to Epstein's home and could provide them upon request.
This intake report was created by the FBI on July 8, 2019, as part of the child sex trafficking investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
